context: Time travel is the concept of moving backwards or forwards to different points in time, in a manner analogous to moving through space, and different from <b6_0>the normal "flow" of time<b6_0/> to an earthbound observer. In this view, <b12_0>all points in time<b12_0/> (including future times) "persist" in some way. <b11_0>Time travel<b11_0/> has been a plot device in fiction <a0_0><b3_0><b8_0>since the 19th century<b8_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/>. Traveling <a1_0><b9_0>backwards<b9_0/><a1_0/> in time has never been verified, presents <b4_0>many theoretic problems<b4_0/>, and may be <b5_0>an impossibility<b5_0/>. Any technological device, whether <b7_0>fictional or hypothetical<b7_0/>, that is used <a2_0><b10_0>to achieve time travel<b10_0/><a2_0/> is known as a time machine.
